评论概述: Great for back, but beware goat heads and shin pain
评论详情: If you're getting a zero drop sole shoe, then these are great. The fabric is a bit elastic which helps make the shoes feel comfortable immediately out of the box. I paired them with some elastic shoe laces and they make a great slip on. They are quiet, fit right but offer no arch support. Simple warnings if you have never had barefoot shoes, the lack of cushion is, at first, very hard on your shins. You will go around a month with shin pain as your body adapts to the change. The pain is never unbearable, but it's a bone pain which is definitely unpleasant. Due to this, don't give up. The temporary shin pain is worth the eventually lack of back pain and strain. While not a perfect solution to lower back pains, the benefits of barefoot shoes and zero drop soles are very real ib my experience and have relieved years of back pain. The next part, specific to this shoe is that the sole is thin. This is intentional but something you may not realize is that it is just thin enough for longer goat heads to penetrate the sole and prick your foot. This came as a shock to me the first time I got soles these thin. If you live in an area where goat heads grow then you may want to look into some sort of sole insert that is puncture resistant. Many are sold for construction workers for protection and they are around $15-35. You are easily able to remove the included insole and replace it and I'd recommend it if you may find yourself walking in goat heads or other such spikes. While you may debate whether or not you should try barefoot shoes and zero drop soles, if you find yourself wanting to try them out then I'd recommend these ones. Good for work, good for walking and worth the money.
Very uncomfortable.

评论详情: Wonderful shoe for driving and around the house. Let's your feet spread and flex naturally, has held up to moderate use (mostly driving and house wear) for a couple years. Essentially no padding or support but good grip. If you want to feel like you're barefoot, but don't want sidewalk goo on your feet this is perfect for you.

评论概述: Whitin's Size Recommendation is Correct (for me)
评论详情: My dress shoe is a 10.5C.  I have bought running shoes for the last 40 years that were 11.5 - using thick Thorlo socks.  Whitin recommended moving up a half size.  Whitin's 11 (44) is just right.  I bought them as an inexpensive introduction to barefoot shoes.  So far, they are durable enough.  Most of my use has been on a treadmill.  I intend to use them on streets over the next few months and see how they fare vs. traditional running shoes (mine are mostly Mizuno or Asics - although I have bought other brands).  I ditch running shoes at 300 miles.

评论概述: Solid yet inexpensive light Breathable running shoe with barefoot sole
评论详情: Running in overly padded running shoes is no good. This barefoot sole running shoe holds up incredibly well to daily street running. At $40 compared to it's $150 counterpart - vivobarefoot, there is not enough of a difference to to make the extra $110 for the vivobarefoot worth it. The wide toe box and and 5mm foot bed are all you need and very comfortable. There is even enough room to add arch inserts if you suffer from plantar fasciitis.
Wear with either long socks or no-show, and you’re golden. Good shoes that are a nice style for the gym and outdoor stuff

The price to get these is phenomenal. Overall I I’ve had a lot of barefoot shoes even Vibram toe shoes but they kept ripping after a year or so. I do a decent amount of outdoor running. I got these to try out and while the price is good they start to fall apart after about 3 months of running ont hem about 10 miles a week or so. You can tell the quality is very mediocre but you can’t really beat the cost. You can already see the sole starting to detach from the shoe and the inside or whatever that’s called just crumbles up inside once you run on them a few times. I ended up just taking it out. I wouldn’t buy them again
Toe box is too narrow for human feet

评论概述: I'd give it 5 stars if it weren't for...
评论详情: The durability on this shoe isn't too great. I have been using the same pair of shoes for almost every day use for 2+ years straight. So here is what I will summarize to keep the journey concise:  The Cons: - The insole fell out and wore out within the first 6 months if I remember correctly. Eventually I just pulled it out and went on like that. - The tread on the shoes also wore out very quickly, with most of it gone also within the first year or 6 months. I used these shoes for playing soccer, and also going to work everyday where I stood on a concrete smooth ground. - The tread now is like paper thin and I am honestly surprised I don't have any holes officially showing. - Don't step in any puddles with these shoes, they get wet easily! Good thing is they can also dry kind of fast, but overall not comfortable getting wet with.  Pros: - Its a barefoot shoe so expect a barefoot experience (which I am a fan of now because I have wide flat feet) - These shoes are SUPER comfortable when you first put them on and have great traction! - I love the elastic all around that feels like a nice hug on my feet all the time without limiting my movement in anyway. - No pinching ever noticed with these shoes they are great for parkour too if you are into that.  Overall: I think its worth the price considering how I abused these shoes for 2 years. However I would love to see some durability improvements to really make this good to recommend to friends. They need a better sole compound overall that will help it last longer.  Hope this helps.

评论概述: Fit is great, but one caveat
评论详情: I wear a size 14, and it is very difficult to find one that actually fits. These fit incredibly well, and leave room for my toes without getting crowded. They are also very comfortable. That said, these are good for walking or running on flat terrain. Do not try wearing these if you are hiking or walking over rocks or textured areas. Your foot will fill every little detail, and you will be suffering later. I brought these camping, and could only wear them for a few hours. However, since I’ve gotten back, I’ve worn them all the time. There’s a time and a place. I would definitely recommend. Just proceeded with caution.
A nice, far less expensive alternative to Vivo Barefoot.  I have received many compliments.

I’ve owned these shoes for the past 60 days, and for the price, they offer excellent value. The comfort level is impressive, and they have held up well through regular wear and even a few trips through the washing machine. If you’re new to bare foot shoes, be aware that they take a bit of adjustment, as you can feel the surface beneath you with each step. The sole is thinner than you're typical shoe, they’re great for everyday walking on level surfaces. However, if you’re planning on walking over rocks, stones, or rougher terrain, be prepared for a bit more impact on your feet due to the thinner sole. While I can’t compare them directly to other barefoot shoes, the sole thickness is definitely something to keep in mind. Overall, for the price and quality, I’d rate these shoes a solid 10 out of 10.

评论概述: Garbage that broke within a year
评论详情: I received these as a gift in the summer of 23, after owning Xero/Merrell barefoot shoes since 2020. While whitin looks far more casual, the build quality is significantly worse, and these have been the only shoes to fail at walking on anything more than concrete. The internal adhesives for the cheap foam insert disintegrated, and the soles fail to protect from even small spiky dandelions (sowthistle) you encounter on the sidewalk. I received this as a loving gift and I despise them, my first pair of vapor glove 3s have spent thousands of more hours on my feet and have held up far more, these whitins are the worst barefoot shoes I own. I've bought a pair of vaporgloves on sale as a replacement that look casual enough to impress the misses, and hopefully they won't fail as blatantly as these into 2025.

Pros: The first lasted a year with almost daily wear, some significant heavy duty wear. They were great wide toe box shoes, and the fit was perfect. They took some getting used to because you still feel rocks and things due to a thin sole, but mostly that’s fine. On occasion it can be a little pokey. They are SUPER slippery on wet rocks or tile, in the grocery store even.  Now for some reason the color of the rubber on the bottom this time is almost pink instead of tan. (I have the black and “gum” color) They are definitely much less sleek with that pinkish tint  In my pictures you can see my first shoe (granted, worn and dirty) is more tan (especially on the side where it’s more original color) rather than the new shoes which are reddish pink?  The wide toe box is basically non existent on the new pair. It really rubbed on my pinky toe. There should not be a period of “breaking them in” with wide toe box shoes— so I’m sending them back. In my picture you can see my old shoe on the right is much wider. Thats how they should be. Overall— disappointing because they were shoes I would have bought over and over again until the design changes.
Use them for running on grass and dirt, also in bodycombat and yoga classes

These are the only pair of gym shoes I use anymore. The thin, flexible, zero-drop soles provide the best stability and grip I’ve found in any shoe I’ve tried. The mesh uppers are super flexible and lightweight and air/dry out quickly. It’s as close to being barefoot as you can get while also getting the protection and grip needed to reduce your risk of injury. As I’m often between sizes (11.5-12 US), I went a size down on these (11), and they fit great. I’ve worn them minimum 2-3 x a week for about 6 months, and they still look practically brand new. When they do wear out, I definitely plan to replace them with a new pair just like them.
